basics.name: Rishabh Gupta
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Pursuing Master of Science, Computer Science, at University Of Florida. Graduating this fall (December, 2018)

work.summary: Technologies: Python, Node JS, Tensorflow, Google Compute Engine and Machine Learning Engine, serverless, AWS Lambda,SQL
highlights: Developed a product recommendation system by building  machine learning models using Tensorflow
Queried Amazon Redshift Database for relevant user-data, such as purchase history, location, etc.
Deployed the said models into production on Google Cloud Platform
Built REST APIs and clients in Node Js to extend and access model’s predictions to send out automated mass promotional emails to existing users
Outcome - Improved e-commerce conversion rate by 1.14 %
Designed and implemented machine learning algorithms to automatically segment out tumor regions from Diffusion-weighted MRI scan images. Dice Coefficient - 68%
Outcome - developed software is being used by doctors at India’s best Medical Institution, AIIMS, Delhi

volunteer.organization: Infinite Energy, Swamphacks, 2018 [ Android, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Node JS, VPS, Deep Learning]
volunteer.summary: Open Doors: An Accessibility-First application that helps blind people navigate busy lobbies using their phone’s camera
highlights: Designed and implemented Deep Learning models using Tensorflow and PyTorch SDKs
Developed Node Js service to support real-time video predictions

volunteer.organization: VandyHacks, 2017 [ Android, Microsoft Cognitive Services, Microsoft Azure Face API, Youtube V3 API, Web Scraping]
volunteer.summary: Musical Faces: Mobile application that recommends music based on user’s facial expressions
highlights: Consumed Microsoft Cognitive Services API and Azure Face API to detect user’s facial expressions
Built a network utility to scrape dynamically updating genre based music lists from the web
Embedded Youtube player and consumed youtube API for in-app streaming of recommendations 3

volunteer.organization: [ Java, Neural Networks, Stanford Core NLP, Natural Language Processing]
volunteer.summary: Sentie: Implemented Dense Neural Networks from scratch along with Natural Language Processing techniques such as n-gram models and parts-of-speech tagging to predict sentiments of paragraphs of text. Dataset - http://sentiwordnet.isti.cnr.it/
